revisionDesc.change: moved rest of notes to external notes file and added ptrs; checked
Silent Proofreading Corrections; update date note and Burroughs visit note
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Changed straight quotes to chararacter reference smart quotes.
Corrected based on proofreading against Ransom Center original copy.
Based date on 15 ct currency issue, George working on pipe, and corroborated visit of Abby Price to LVVW by Walt Whitman on July 16; corrected based on oral proofreading.

body.p:
I got your letter walter dear to day today George is staying hom home now to superentent superintend the big pipe to be laid from the engine house he is better i think since he come he had to walk from the foundry
to the hotel even days in the heat to his dinner a mile he says it was from the foundry and when he got there he couldent couldn't eat he has lost several pounds in flesh and looks rather bad he says he would like to lay off awhile but he cant can't

it is very pleasant this thursday Thursday morning and i feel better that i have felt for the last few days george started this morning a little after 6 oclo o'clock he has to walk to atlantic st Atlantic Street and take the cars for east new york New York so he has to have his breakfesbreakfast early

well walt as you say there aint ain't much to write about only i thought you would think stange strange if i dident didn't write) O walt aint ain't them 15 cts bills nice george bought them all but two of me i suppose they will soon be in circulation)
you dident didn't say if Burroughs was returned) i look for hellen price and her mother to day today they were to come the last of this week and its cool to day today i havent haven't heard how nobody is this morning he is to be the ingeneerengineer of the bridge he has been very low but i suppose he is living)
no more at present you will come next month love to mr and mrs oconor
